intro: Paraixeris chelidoniifolia, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
